intro: Cupaniopsis insularis, commonly known as the Island Cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, often grayish bark. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a waxy texture. Cupaniopsis insularis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in coastal or lowland areas.
